noun.description: A mineral of the cubic crystal system consisting of a hydrated arsenate of iron and potassium (often also containing other elements, especially barium or sodium), and usually occurring as minute greenish or brownish crystals of cubic or tetrahedral form.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Shepard (1804–1886). From pharmaco- + siderite, after German Pharmakosiderit.
